revised_title: Temperature Variation of Spontaneous Magnetization in Ferromagnetic Metals
tldr: The authors investigate the temperature variation of spontaneous magnetization in ferromagnetic metals using the Green function method. They find that spin-wave excitations of small wave vector occur with energies proportional to the temperature, leading to an analytical expression for the constant that differs from the Heisenberg model. This work provides a consistent explanation of ferromagnetism within the band theory.
